TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ScriptingRoleServiceSection extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection

Docs.summary: Represents the configuration section for role-service settings.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ScriptingRoleServiceSection class enables you to programmatically access and modify the `roleService` element of the configuration section for using AJAX functionality in [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/add/includes/vstecasp-md.md)].
The role service is typically used to retrieve role information for the user who is logged on by using an asynchronous Web service call.
## Examples The following configuration file excerpt shows how to declaratively specify values for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ScriptingRoleServiceSection.Enabled%2A> property of the ScriptingRoleServiceSection class.
``` <system.web.extensions> <scripting> <webServices> <roleService enabled="true" /> </webServices> </scripting> </system.web.extensions> ```
The following example shows how to access the ScriptingRoleServiceSection element programmatically.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.configurati_42_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.configurati_42_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the role service is enabled for an [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/add/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] application that uses AJAX features.
Docs.value: if the role service is enabled; otherwise, . The default is .
